agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach programs, including a food pantry.
site_name: GRACE UNITED METHODIST CHURCH FOOD PANTRY
service_description: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach programs, including a food pantry.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Blackford County

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization working to prevent and reduce the harmful effects of alcohol, tobacco, and other drug use among youth and adults in Jay County.
site_name: JAY COUNTY DRUG PREVENTION COALITION - HARTFORD CITY
service_description: Provides a peer recovery support group for those with substance use disorders.
site_details: Walk in at designated time.
site_eligibility: Individuals wanting recovery support -- Individuals wanting recovery support from substance use disorder or addiction

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Blackford County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Blackford County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions
site_details: Call for assistance.

site_schedule.name: General Relief Appeals/Complaints
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: 1st and 3rd Mon 8:30am

site_schedule.name: Local Officials Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: 1st and 3rd Mon 8:30am

site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains  marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.

site_schedule.name: Child Support Assistance/Enforcement
site_schedule.schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_schedule.name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices

site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county
Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support
Varies by service; serves Blackford County
Registering to vote: US citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Blackford County, including patching, paving, snow removal, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 or Blackford County dispatch.

site_schedule.name: Street Maintenance
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 7am-3pm -- On call for emergencies daily 24 hours

site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Blackford County)

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Blackford County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for information.
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Blackford County Courts
Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court
Age 17 or under

Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $10,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Blackford County, Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Blackford County, or Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Dunkirk.
service_description: Provides street and sidewalk maintenance, storm-sewer maintenance, snow and ice control, dead animal pick-up, street-sign maintenance, mosquito control, and grounds-keeping of public properties in the city of Dunkirk.
site_details: Call for information, to submit a request, or make a report.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Dunkirk

agency_desc: A community action agency offering seasonal energy assistance, Head Start, and other programs for eligible persons.
site_name: COMMUNITY AND FAMILY SERVICES - BLACKFORD COUNTY
service_description: Offers household cleaning supplies, paper goods, hygiene supplies and pet food to the public at reduced prices.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Blackford County

Living within Hartford City city limits -- Meeting established monthly income guidelines (based on household size): 1 person: $1900 -- 2 people: $2426 -- 3 people: $3051 -- 4 people: $3677 -- 5 people: $4303 -- 6 people: $4929 -- (Add $626 for each additional household member) -- Not received food from this pantry within the last 30 days

agency_desc: A community action agency offering seasonal energy assistance, Head Start, and other programs for eligible persons.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in to sign in and receive a number; clients will be called to the pantry by number.
site_eligibility: Living within Montpelier city limits -- Meeting established monthly income guidelines (based on household size): 1 person: $1800 -- 2 people: $2426 -- 3 people: $30510 -- 4 people: $3677 -- 5 people: $4303 -- 6 people: $4929 -- (Add $626 for each additional household member) -- Not received food from this pantry within the last 30 days

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Blackford County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Blackford County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on property description and owner of record.
site_details: Call or visit website for more information. www.blackfordcounty.com
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Blackford County

agency_desc: A faith-based organization with a mission "to provide compassionate Rescue services on an immediate and/or long-term basis to the poor and needy of Muncie and East Central Indiana."
site_name: MUNCIE MISSION MINISTRIES ATTIC WINDOW - HARTFORD CITY
service_description: Provides emergency assistance with rent or utilities for Blackford County residents in need. Applicants must apply with their township trustee first. No deposit assistance available. Utilities must have a disconnect notice in order to receive assistance. All assistance is provided on a case-by-case basis when funding is available.
site_details: Call to schedule a virtual appointment. -- Submit documents via email prior to virtual appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Blackford County -- Must have a current application with their trustee office and completed any owed work hours -- Not received financial assistance from this agency within the past 12 months
Living in Blackford County -- Food pantry assistance limited to once a month -- Clothing assistance limited to once every 3 months -- Household items once 12 months
Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network providing preeminent care throughout Indiana.
service_description: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care. Patient information and support services are available for families of admitted patients.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A designated community mental health center for Blackford and Grant County, offering a range of mental health and addiction treatment services.
service_description: Provides assessment and outpatient counseling and treatment for people with substance abuse issues and their families.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call the office to schedule an initial assessment or to cancel/change an existing appointment. For after-hours emergencies or concerns, call the crisis line.

site_schedule.name: Substance Use Disorder Counseling
site_schedule.schedule:
• Radiant Health Hartford City: Mon-Thurs 8am-6pm
• Radiant Health South: Mon-Thurs 8am-8pm; Fri 8am-noon
• Crisis Services: Daily 24 hours

site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- In need of outpatient substance abuse treatment services (based on assessment)

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Coordinates lead poisoning case management for youth living within the County.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living within the county -- Ages 1-7

Living within the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years-old -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status
Living within the county
Age 6 months or older
Varies by service
Age 18 or older
Schools, community organizations, and other groups
Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call or email for information or to request an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency offering recreation and socialization activities for seniors.
service_description: Provides lunch for people in need.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Blackford County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Blackford County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Blackford County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Blackford County
To visit: Must be on the inmate's approved visitor list -- Age 18 or older (or accompanied by someone over 18 who is also on the inmate's visitor list-

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living, working, or owning property in Harrison Township or the city of Montpelier

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living, working, or own property in Jackson, Licking, or Washington Township or Hartford City

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization offering charitable outreach programs, including limited financial assistance, to Blackford County persons in need.
service_description: Provides limited financial assistance to those in need. Funds may be used for electric, gas, water, and heating fuel bills. Assistance is dependent on funding and determined on a case-by-case basis. Limit one time per household each year.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Blackford County  -- Applied for assistance with township trustee and Attic Window  -- Not received funds from this agency within the past year

agency_desc: Enforces animal-related ordinances, responds to animal-related emergencies, impounds stray domestic animals, and accepts surrendered animals from the public. Provides lost-and-found services, microchipping of pets, humane euthanasia for terminally ill pets, and adoption for homeless dogs and cats. Issues pet licenses.
service_description: Accepts donations of pet food and supplies for shelter use. Needed items often include bleach, laundry detergent, dish soap, paper towel, trash bags, scoopable litter, toys for cats and dogs, metal food bowls, blankets, and towels. Volunteers to assist with shelter duties, including walking the dogs, playing with the cats, foster animals, help with fund raisers and adoption events, are also welcome.
site_details: Call or walk in to make donation arrangements or to inquire about volunteering.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Hartford City in Blackford County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For non-emergency services, call the office during business hours or call Blackford County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Hartford City
